thread.title: NHL: Los Angeles Kings blank Carolina Hurricanes
thread.title_full: NHL: Los Angeles Kings blank Carolina Hurricanes

author: Associated Press
title: NHL: Los Angeles Kings blank Carolina Hurricanes
text:
NHL: Los Angeles Kings blank Carolina Hurricanes Associated Press Posted: 10/23/2015 10:42:28 PM PDT Updated: 10/23/2015 10:42:30 PM PDT friDAY'S HIGHLIGHTS Kings 3, Hurricanes 0: Jonathan Quick made 40 saves in his 38th career shutout and Tyler Toffoli scored twice in Los Angeles' fourth straight victory. The Kings have followed a 0-3-0 start by allowing just three goals during four gritty wins. 
Canadiens 7, Sabres 2: Andrei Markov had a goal and four assists and Montreal beat Buffalo to run its season-opening winning streak to eight games. The Canadiens are two wins away from matching the NHL record set by the Toronto Maple Leafs in 1993-94 and matched by the Sabres in 2006-07. 
Flames 3, Red Wings 2: Mark Giordano scored his second goal of the game in overtime and Calgary came back to end a four-game losing streak. Detroit lost its fourth straight. 
Lightning 4, Jets 3: Ondrej Palat scored 36 seconds into overtime and Tampa Bay beat Winnipeg. 
Capitals 7, Oilers 4: Evgeny Kuznetsov had three goals and two assists to help Washington beat Edmonton. 
Bruins 5, Islanders 3: David Pastrnak broke a tie late in the second period and Boston beat New York. 
Stars: Defenseman Jason Demers was suspended for two games without pay by the NHL for elbowing Pittsburgh Penguins forward Nick Bonino. The suspension will cost Demers $36,559. 
Obituary: Jimmy Roberts, a five-time Stanley Cup champion with the Canadiens and an original member of the St. Louis Blues, died. He was 75. -- ASSOCIATED PRESS
